intro: Janusia sericea, commonly known as the silky Janusia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a cluster at the tip of the stem. Janusia sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
